channel.title: BBC News - England

item.title: Concern mounts for missing 11-year-old schoolgirl from Bolton
item.description: The parents of Fatuma Kadir, who travelled from Manchester to London by train, say they are in "shock".

item.title: Covid: North East gets five-week government support to slow growth
item.description: From Monday extra help will be given to the region to ramp up testing and vaccine rollouts.

item.title: Daily Covid cases down for third day in UK
item.description: New infections are down but it is too soon to say if cases have peaked, say experts.

item.title: Makina: the UK subculture you've probably never heard of
item.description: A leading MC says the music genre's return after Covid is going to be "something special".

item.title: Met Office storm warning for campsites and caravans
item.description: Thunderstorms and 55mph gusts of wind could disrupt the plans of holidaymakers, the Met Office says.

item.title: Tributes to Stoke-on-Trent man who died on trip to beach
item.description: The family of 21-year-old Hamza Mansoor have thanked "all the heroes" who tried to save him.

item.title: Newcastle library book returned 63 years late
item.description: The copy of How to Lie with Statistics is decades past its return date of 25 November 1958.

item.title: M62 police shooting: Inquest into death of Yassar Yaqub put back
item.description: Judge Guy Kearl QC tells a pre-inquest review it is necessary to ensure "all angles are considered".

item.title: Soldier found dead in barracks at Larkhill, Salisbury
item.description: The Ministry of Defence says it is investigating the circumstances surrounding her death.

item.title: Sarm Heslop: Missing woman's parents still have hope
item.description: Four months after she vanished, it is still not known what happened to Sarm Heslop.

item.title: Durham A1 crash: Seaham couple named as Elaine Sullivan and David Daglish
item.description: Three people died in the collision involving two lorries and four cars on the A1 (M) last week.

item.title: Life-sized Laurel and Hardy statues stolen again
item.description: Lesley Haylett says the figures have been stolen from outside her home for a fourth time.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Covid-19: DJ SUAT takes nightclub on to the streets
item.description: After coronavirus shut the nightclubs he DJs in, SUAT, of Oxted, took his decks on to the streets.

item.title: London Ambulance Service facing busiest July in history
item.description: Paramedics say the weather and easing of Covid restrictions has led to a surge in calls.

item.title: Bristol plant blown up in controlled explosion
item.description: About 300kg of explosives was used to bring down the disused building at Avonmouth near Bristol.

item.title: Moeen Ali visits his new portrait in Birmingham park
item.description: The England star captains Birmingham Phoenix in cricket's newest tournament.

item.title: Scarborough beach day trips for Barrowcliff estate children
item.description: A community group has been getting children from Scarborough's Barrowcliff estate to the beach.

item.title: Frank Varey: Teenage boxing champion dies after river swim
item.description: Tributes are being paid to Frank Varey, 16, whose body was pulled from the River Dee in Cheshire.

item.title: Oxfordshire lake death: Mother pays tribute to 'caring' daughter
item.description: Nicole Sanders was one of six people who died last weekend after having problems in water in England.

item.title: Essex lorry deaths: Man ordered to pay £3k to families
item.description: Alexandru-Ovidiu Hanga made £83,552 from crime but just £3,000 is available, the Old Bailey hears.

item.title: The Smithy Family quit TikTok after arson attack
item.description: Nick Smith told followers the family were "taking time to fix themselves" after the house fire.

item.title: Trapped squirrel freed from inside Cambridge lamp-post
item.description: An RSPCA inspector says it was one of the more unusual animal rescues he has attended.

item.title: Keon Lincoln: Teenager denies murdering 15-year-old Birmingham boy
item.description: Four other youths have also denied murdering Keon Lincoln, who was shot and stabbed in Birmingham.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics officially open as Osaka lights flame in poignant ceremony
item.description: The Tokyo 2020 Games are officially under way as Naomi Osaka lights the Olympic flame in a poignant opening ceremony.

item.title: T20 debut on Sunday, Hundred matchwinner on Friday - Benjamin stars in thrilling Phoenix win
item.description: Unknown 22-year-old Chris Benjamin leads Birmingham Phoenix to a stunning last-gasp victory over London Spirit in the men's Hundred.

item.title: Jadon Sancho: England winger completes £73m move to Manchester United from Borussia Dortmund
item.description: England winger Jadon Sancho completes his £73m move to Manchester United from Borussia Dortmund.

item.title: Harry Kane: Latest on Man City target's future
item.description: After Harry Kane was linked to a £160m move to Manchester City, what is the latest with the Tottenham and England striker's future?

item.title: Super League: Leeds Rhinos 38-16 Salford Red Devils - Leeming inspires Rhinos to victory
item.description: Kruise Leeming scores twice as Leeds comfortably beat Salford 38-16 to register their first win in three Super League games.
